task.title: Set Visible Margins
task.shortdesc: You can set your desired margin size by activating your typewriters' margin stops.

taskbody.prereq: t is best to insert your paper before setting your margins, as you may need to use the edge of your paper as a reference.

substep.note: It is best practice to center your carriage to maintain equal margin alignment and prevent difficulty when resetting margins.
substep.cmd: Press the carriage centering lever on the right-hand side of your typewriter.
Press down and slide the margin stop left or right, using the measurements on your carriage as a guide.
Slide the left margin stop to where you want to start typing on your paper, and release pressure from the tab to set it in place.
Repeat for the right margin stop, setting it where you want your text to end on your paper.
Slide the carriage between each margin stop. The carriage should halt in movement at each stop.
